Annotation.String: The Processor schema describes the information about a single processor that a system contains. A processor includes both performance characteristics, clock speed, architecture, core count, and so on, and compatibility, such as the CPU ID instruction results.

This Resource shall represent a single processor that a system contains. A processor includes both performance characteristics, clock speed, architecture, core count, and so on, and compatibility, such as the CPU ID instruction results.
The socket or location of the processor.
This property shall contain the string that identifies the physical location or socket of the processor.
The type of processor.
This property shall contain the string that identifies the type of processor contained in this Socket.
The architecture of the processor.
This property shall contain the string that identifies the architecture of the processor contained in this Socket.
The instruction set of the processor.
This property shall contain the string that identifies the instruction set of the processor contained in this socket.
The identification information for this processor.
This object shall contain identification information for this processor.
The status and health of the Resource and its subordinate or dependent Resources.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the Resource.
The processor manufacturer.
This property shall contain a string that identifies the manufacturer of the processor.
The product model number of this device.
This property shall indicate the model information as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
The maximum clock speed of the processor.
This property shall indicate the maximum rated clock speed of the processor in MHz.
The total number of cores that this processor contains.
This property shall indicate the total count of independent processor cores contained within this processor.
The total number of execution threads that this processor supports.
This property shall indicate the total count of independent execution threads that this processor supports.
The identification information for a processor.
This type shall contain identification information for a processor.
The vendor identification for this processor.
This property shall indicate the vendor Identification string information as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
The raw manufacturer-provided CPUID instruction output for this processor.
This property shall contain the raw manufacturer-provided CPUID instruction output for this processor.
The effective family for this processor.
This property shall indicate the effective Family information as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
The effective model for this processor.
This property shall indicate the effective Model information as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
The step value for this processor.
This property shall indicate the Step or revision string information as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
The microcode information for this processor.
This property shall indicate the Microcode Information as provided by the manufacturer of this processor.
A CPU.
A GPU.
An FPGA.
A DSP.
An accelerator.
A core in a processor.
A thread in a processor.
An OEM-defined processing unit.
Intel Itanium.
x86 32-bit.
x86 64-bit.
Intel IA-64.
ARM 32-bit.
ARM 64-bit.
MIPS 32-bit.
MIPS 64-bit.
PowerISA-64 or PowerISA-32.
This version was created to show that annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show that annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show that annotations in previous namespaces were updated.

This version was created to add Units annotations to the MaxSpeedMHz property. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to use the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
The links to other Resources that are related to this Resource.
The Redfish Specification-described Links Property shall contain links to Resources related to but not subordinate to this Resource.
The available actions for this Resource.
This property shall contain the available actions for this Resource.
The links to other Resources that are related to this Resource.
The Redfish Specification-described type shall contain links to Resources related to but not subordinate to this Resource.
The link to the chassis that contains this processor.
This property shall contain a link to a Resource of type chassis that represents the physical container associated with this processor.
The available actions for this Resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this Resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this Resource.
This property shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this Resource.
The available OEM-specific actions for this Resource.
This type shall contain the available OEM-specific actions for this Resource.

This version was created to add Units annotations on the MaxSpeedMHz property. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to use the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
The location of the processor.
This property shall contain location information of the associated processor.
The link to an assembly associated with this processor.
This property shall contain a link to a Resource of type assembly.

This version was created to add Units annotations on the MaxSpeedMHz property. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to use the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
The link to the collection of subprocessors associated with this system, such as cores or threads, that are part of a processor.
This property shall contain a link to a Resource Collection of type ProcessorCollection.

This version was created to add Units annotations on the MaxSpeedMHz property. It was also created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to use the new Revisions annotation.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
This version was created to add TDPWatts and MaxTDPWatts. It was also created to add Power architecture to ProcessorArchitecture and PowerISA to InstructionSet.
The nominal Thermal Design Power (TDP) in watts.
This property shall contain the nominal Thermal Design Power (TDP) in watts.
The maximum Thermal Design Power (TDP) in watts.
This property shall contain the maximum Thermal Design Power (TDP) in watts.
The link to the metrics associated with this processor.
This property shall contain a link to the metrics associated with this processor.
The UUID for this processor.

This property shall contain a universal unique identifier number for the processor. RFC4122 describes methods to use to create the value. The value should be considered to be opaque. Client software should only treat the overall value as a universally unique identifier and should not interpret any sub-fields within the UUID.
The memory directly attached or integrated witin this Procesor.
This property shall contain the memory directly attached or integrated witin this Processor.
The properties for processors of the FPGA type.
This property shall contain an object containing properties for processors of the FPGA type.
The link to the collection of acceleration functions associated with this processor.
This property shall contain a link to a Resource Collection of type AccelerationFunctionCollection.
An array of links to the endpoints that connect to this processor.
This property shall contain an array of links of the Endpoint type that represent endpoints accociated with this Processor.
An array of links to the processors directly connected to this processor.
This property shall contain an array of links of the Processor type that are directly connected to this Processor.
The link to the PCIe device associated with this processor.
This property shall contain a link of the PCIeDevice type that represents the PCIe device associated with this processor.
An array of links to the PCIeFunctions associated with this Processor.
This property shall contain an array of links of the PCIeFunction type that represent the PCIe functions associated with this Processor.
This type describes the memory directly attached or integrated within a processor.
This type shall contain information about memory directly attached or integratied within a processor.
An indication of whether this memory is integrated within the processor.
This property shall indicate whether this memory is integrated within the processor. Otherwise, it is discrete memory attached to the processor.
The type of memory used by this processor.
This property shall contain a type of the processor memory type.
The memory capacity in MiB.
This property shall contain the memory capacity in MiB.
The operating speed of the memory in MHz.
This property shall contain the operating speed of the memory in MHz.
L1 cache.
L2 cache.
L3 cache.
L4 cache.
L5 cache.
L6 cache.
L7 cache.
High Bandwidth Memory.
The second generation of High Bandwidth Memory.
The third generation of High Bandwidth Memory.
Synchronous graphics RAM.
Synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate type two synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate type three synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate type four synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate type five synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate type five synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate type five synchronous graphics random-access memory.
Double data rate synchronous dynamic random-access memory.
Double data rate type two synchronous dynamic random-access memory.
Double data rate type three synchronous dynamic random-access memory.
Double data rate type four synchronous dynamic random-access memory.
Double data rate type five synchronous dynamic random-access memory.
Synchronous dynamic random-access memory.
Static random-access memory.
Flash memory.
The properties of the FPGA device.
This object shall contain the properties of the FPGA device represented by a processor.
The FPGA type.
This property shall contain a type of the FPGA device.
The FPGA model.
This property shall contain a model of the FPGA device.
The FPGA firmware identifier.
This property shall contain a string decsribing the FPGA firmware identifier.
The FPGA firmware manufacturer.
This property shall contain a string decsribing the FPGA firmware manufacturer.
The FPGA firmware version.
This property shall contain a string decsribing the FPGA firmware version.
The FPGA interface to the host.
This property shall contain an object that describes the connectivity to the host for system software to use.
An array of the FPGA external interfaces.
This property shall contain an array of objects that describe the external connectivity of the FPGA.
The number of the PCIe Virtual Functions.
This property shall contain an integer that describes the number of PCIe Virtual Functions configured within the FPGA.
An indication of whether the FPGA firmware can be reprogrammed from the host by using system software.

This property shall indicate whether the FPGA firmware can be reprogrammed from the host by using system software. If false, system software shall not be able to program the FPGA firmware from the system interface. In either state, a management controller may be able to program the FPGA firmware by using the sideband interface.
An array of the FPGA reconfiguration slots. An FPGA uses a reconfiguration slot to contain an acceleration function that can change as the FPGA is provisioned.
This property shall contain an array of the structures that describe the FPGA reconfiguration slots that the acceleration functions can program.
The OEM extension property.
This property shall contain the OEM extensions. All values for properties contained in this object shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.
This type describes the FPGA reconfiguration slot. An FPGA uses a reconfiguration slot to contain an acceleration function that can change as the FPGA is provisioned.
This type shall contain information about the FPGA reconfiguration slot.
The FPGA reconfiguration slot identifier.
This property shall contain the FPGA reconfiguration slot identifier.
The UUID for this reconfiguration slot.
This property shall contain a universal unique identifier number for the reconfiguration slot.
An indication of whether the reconfiguration slot can be reprogrammed from the host by using system software.

This property shall indicate whether the reconfiguration slot can be reprogrammed from the host by using system software. If false, system software shall not be able to program the reconfiguration slot from the system interface. In either state, a management controller may be able to program the reconfiguration slot by using the sideband interface.
The link to the acceleration function that the code programmed into a reconfiguration slot provides.
This property shall contain a link to the acceleration function that the code programmed into a reconfiguration slot provides. It shall link to a Resource of type AccelerationFunction.
The FPGA device integrasted with other processor in the single chip.
The discrete FPGA device.
This type describes an interface to the FPGA.
This type shall contain information about the interface to the FPGA.
The FPGA interface type.
This property shall contain an enumerated value that describes the type of interface to the FPGA.
The PCIe-related information for this FPGA interface.
This property shall contain an object the describes the PCIe-related information for this FPGA interface.
The Ethernet-related information for this FPGA interface.
This property shall contain an object the describes the Ethernet-related information for this FPGA interface.
This type defines an Ethernet interface.
These properties shall contain the definition for an Ethernet interface for a Redfish implementation.
The OEM extension property.
This property shall contain the OEM extensions. All values for properties contained in this object shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.
The maximum speed supported by this interface.
This property shall contain the maximum speed supported by this interface.
The number of lanes supported by this interface.
This property shall contain the maximum number of lanes supported by this interface.
The Intel QuickPath Interconnect.
The Intel UltraPath Interconnect.
A PCI Express interface.
An Ethernet interface.
An OEM-defined interface.

This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that URI properties use the uri-reference format, and to add a missing term to several properties to disallow them from being null.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
This version was created to add TotalEnabledCores property.
The total number of enabled cores that this processor contains.
This property shall indicate the total count of enabled independent processor cores contained within this processor.
This version was created to update descriptions that this schema defines.
